revision.comment: capitalization of a few other words too
revision.text:
{{Marketing}} {{for|ads that follow you around|behavioral retargeting}} '''Ad tracking''', also known as post-testing or ad effectiveness tracking, is in-market research that [[Copy testing|monitors a brand’s performance]] including [[brand awareness|brand]] and [[advertising]] awareness, product trial and usage, and attitudes about the brand versus their competition. Depending on the speed of the [[purchase cycle]] in the category, tracking can be done continuously (a few interviews every week) or it can be “pulsed,” with interviews conducted in widely spaced waves (ex. every three or six months). Interviews can either be conducted with separate, matched samples of consumers, or with a single ([[longitudinal study|longitudinal]]) panel that is interviewed over time. Since the researcher has information on when the ads launched, the length of each advertising flight, the money spent, and when the interviews were conducted, the results of ad tracking can provide information on the effects of advertising. ==Purpose== The purpose of ad tracking is generally to provide a measure of the combined effect of the [[media weight]] or spending level, the effectiveness of the media buy or targeting, and the quality of the advertising executions or creative. Advertisers use the results of ad tracking to estimate the [[return on investment]] (ROI) of advertising, and to refine advertising plans. Sometimes, tracking data are used to provide inputs to Marketing Mix Models which marketing science statisticians build to estimate the role of advertising, as compared to [[pricing]], distribution and other marketplace variables on sales of the brand. ==Methodology== Today, most ad tracking studies are conducted via the [[Internet]]. Some ad tracking studies are conducted continuously and others are conducted at specific points in time (typically before the advertising appears in market, and then again after the advertising has been running for some period of time). The two approaches use different types of analyses, although both start by measuring advertising awareness. Typically, the respondent is either shown a brief portion of a commercial or a few memorable still images from the TV ad. Other media typically are cued using either branded or de-branded visual of the ad. Then, respondents answer three significant questions. # Do you recognize this ad? (recognition measure) # Please type in the sponsor of this ad. ([[Wiktionary: unaided awareness|unaided awareness]] measure) # Please choose from the following list, the sponsor of this ad. ([[Wiktionary: aided awareness|aided awareness]] measure) The continuous tracking design analyzes advertising awareness over time, in relation to ad spending; separately, this design tracks brand awareness, and then develops indices of effectiveness based on the strength of the correlations between ad spending and brand awareness. The most popular alternate approach to the continuous tracking design is the [[Communicants]] System longitudinal design, in which the same people are interviewed at two points in time. Changes in brand measures (for example, brand purchasing and future [[purchase intention]]s) exhibited among those who have seen the advertising are compared to the changes in brand measures that occurred among those unaware of advertising. By means of this method, the researchers can isolate those marketplace changes that were produced by advertising versus those that would have occurred without advertising. ==Internet tracking== There are several different tools to track [[online ad]]s: [[banner ad]]s, [[Pay per click|ppc]] ads, [[pop-up ad]]s, and other types. Several online advertising companies such as [[Google]] offer their own ad [[internet tracking|tracking]] service ([[Google Analytics]]) in order to effectively use their service to generate a positive ROI. Third-party ad tracking services are commonly used by affiliate marketers. Affiliate marketers are frequently unable to have access to the order page and therefore are unable to use a 3rd-party tool. Many different companies have created tools to effectively track their commissions in order to optimize their profit potential. The information provided will show the marketer which advertising methods are generating income and which are not and allows him to effectively allocate his budget. ==Measures== Here is a list of some of the data a post-test might provide:
*[[Top of mind awareness]] *Unaided brand awareness *Aided brand awareness *Brand fit *Brand image ratings *Brand trial *Engagement/ involvement *Repeat purchase *Frequency of use *Price perceptions *Unaided advertising awareness *Aided advertising awareness *Unaided advertising message recall *Aided advertising message recall *Aided commercial recall *[[Ad wear out]] *Promotion awareness and usage *Purchase intention *[[Market segment]] characteristics *[[media consumption|Media habits]] *[[Lifestyle (sociology)|Lifestyle]]/[[Psychographics]] *[[Demographics]]
==See also==
*[[Advertising]] *[[Advertising management]] *[[Advertising Research]] *[[Brand management]] *[[Effective frequency]] *[[Integrated marketing communications]] *[[Marketing research]] *[[Web analytics]] *[[Millward Brown]] *[[Ameritest]] *[[Advertising Checking Bureau]] *[[Brand]]ing *[[Communicus]] *[[wikt: brand image|Brand Image]] *[[wikt: brand linkage|Brand Linkage]] *[[Global Marketing|Global Advertising]] *[[Marketing]] *[[Marketing communications]] *[[Mass media]] *[[Media planning]] *[[Marketing research]] *[[Motivation]] * [[New media]] * [[Positioning (marketing)]] * [[Promotion (marketing)|Promotion]] * [[Promotional mix]] * [[Reach (advertising)]]
==Further reading== * Zeff, Robbin (1999). ''Advertising on the Internet, 2nd Edition.'' John Wiley & Sons {{ISBN|978-0-471-34404-9}} * Linktrack (2008). [http://linktrack.info/p/ad_tracker "Ad Tracker: Definition and Use"]. * Kaushik, Avinash (2009). ''Web Analytics 2.0: The Art of Online Accountability and Science of Customer Centricity'' Sybex. * Ravi Pathak & Siegfried Stepke (2014). [http://www.tatvic.com/webinar/impact-tv-advertisement-website-traffic/ "Webinar: Understanding the Impact of TV Advertisement on Website Traffic"]. ==References== {{Reflist}} * Young, Charles E., ''The Advertising Research Handbook'', Ideas in Flight, Seattle, WA, April 2005, {{ISBN|0-9765574-0-1}} * Rydholm, Joseph (2000). [http://www.quirks.com/articles/a2000/20000303.aspx?searchID=17888422&sort=9 "Campaigning for the outdoors"]. Quirk's Marketing Research Review. Retrieved on 2008-12-1 [[Category:Advertising]] [[Category:Market research]] [[Category:Promotion and marketing communications]]

revision.comment: Clarified is a subject's name and entity is a corporation.
revision.text:
The '''American Association of Christian Counselors, Inc.''' ('''AACC''') is the largest organization of [[Christian counseling|Christian counselors]] in the world.<ref name="lang">Brian Lang, Bill Wilson, ''A christian parents' guide to making the internet family friendly'', [[Nashville, Tennessee]]: [[Thomas Nelson (publisher)|Thomas Nelson]], 1999 [https://books.google.com/books?id=P7rni7b8zFcC&pg=PT50&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=AIobTqbZCeHt0gH5yuTbBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CEQQ6AEwAzgK#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref>
==Overview== It is a [[corporation]] <ref>{{cite web |title=Business Entity Details 06243554 |url=https://sccefile.scc.virginia.gov/Business/0624355 |website=State Corporation Commission |publisher=Commonwealth of Virginia |accessdate=28 October 2018 |quote=SCC ID: 06243554; Entity Type: Corporation; Jurisdiction of Formation: VA; Date of Formation/Registration: 9/24/2004}}</ref> headquartered in [[Forest, Virginia]], United States.<ref>James V. Geisendorfer, ''Religion in America: a directory'', [[Brill Archive]], 1983, p. 4 [https://books.google.com/books?id=5A0VAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA4&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=zIgbTq3yG6Hf0QGY9dXgBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref> AACC, as it is often called, creates the largest gathering of Christian counselors once per year in North America with annual conferences that often exceed 5,000 attendees. Speakers for these events include, [[Henry Cloud|Dr. Henry Cloud]], [[John Townsend (author)|Dr. John Townsend]], Gary Smalley, Larry Crabb, T.D. Jakes, Ron Hawkins, John Trent, Emmerson Eggrich, Joni Tada, Arch Harte, John Eldredge, and a host of other popular Christian writers. AACC is under the direction of Dr. Tim Clinton and celebrates their 25th anniversary as a professional trade association in 2011. They were previously headquartered in [[Fairfax, Virginia]].<ref>Randolph K. Sanders, ''Christian counseling ethics: a handbook for therapists, pastors & counselors'', [[Westmond, Illinois]]: [[InterVarsity Press]], 1997, p. 390 [https://books.google.com/books?id=bMBog7pMvCsC&pg=PA390&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=spcbToSkFcTd0QGLraX8Bw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CDIQ6AEwADgU#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref> It has about nearly 50,000 members.<ref>Timothy Clinton, Archibald D. Harte, ''Caring for People God's Way: Personal and Emotional Issues, Addictions, Grief, and Trauma'', Nashville, Tennessee: Thomas Nelson, 2006 p. 506 [https://books.google.com/books?id=ptYRUlKFiaQC&pg=PA506&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=spcbToSkFcTd0QGLraX8Bw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=7&ved=0CFMQ6AEwBjgU#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref> It publishes two [[Magazine|journal]]s: ''Christian Counseling Today'' and ''Marriage and Family: A Christian Journal''.<ref name="koenig">Harold George Koenig, ''Handbook of religion and mental health'', [[Amsterdam, Netherlands]]: [[Elsevier]], 1998, p. 342 [https://books.google.com/books?id=504GYYj1O3kC&pg=PA342&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=AIobTqbZCeHt0gH5yuTbBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=7&ved=0CFQQ6AEwBjgK#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref> It has adopted a [[code of ethics]] used for Christian counseling.<ref name="russell">Lori Ann Russell-Chapin, Ted Chapin, ''Clinical Supervision: Theory and Practice'', [[Stamford, Connecticut]]: [[Cengage Learning]], 2011, p. 195 [https://books.google.com/books?id=JnUNsT4oDVUC&pg=PA195&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=AIobTqbZCeHt0gH5yuTbBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CFkQ6AEwBzgK#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref><ref name="siang">Siang-Yang Tan, ''Counseling and Psychotherapy: A Christian Perspective'', [[Grand Rapids, Michigan]]: [[Baker Academic]], 2011, p. 375 [https://books.google.com/books?id=wtQV4u2yLHIC&pg=PA375&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=zIgbTq3yG6Hf0QGY9dXgBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CFcQ6AEwBw#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref><ref name="clinton">Tim Clinton, Ron Hawkins, ''The Popular Encyclopedia of Christian Counseling: An Indispensable Tool for Helping People with Their Problems'', [[Irvine, California]]: [[Harvest House Publishers]], 2011, p. 77 [https://books.google.com/books?id=TCImZOSzPOgC&pg=PA77&dq=%22American+Association+of+Christian+Counselors%22&hl=en&ei=zIgbTq3yG6Hf0QGY9dXgBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CEIQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=%22American%20Association%20of%20Christian%20Counselors%22&f=false]</ref> In 2014 AACC amended its code of ethics to eliminate the promotion of [[conversion therapy]] for homosexuals and encouraged them to be celibate instead.<ref name="religionnews1">{{cite web|url=http://www.religionnews.com/2014/08/04/gay-christian-celibate-changing-face-homosexuality-debate/ |title=Gay, Christian and ... celibate: The changing face of the homosexuality debate - Religion News Service |publisher=Religionnews.com |date= |accessdate=2015-07-07}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Psychology organizations based in the United States]] [[Category:Bedford County, Virginia]] [[Category:Counseling]]

{{use dmy dates|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox person |name = Andreas Vgenopoulos
Ανδρέας Βγενόπουλος |image = |image_size = |alt = |caption = |birth_name = |birth_date = {{Birth date|1953|12|10|df=yes}} |birth_place = [[Athens]], Greece |death_date = {{Death date and age|2016|11|05|1953|12|10|df=yes}} |death_place = Athens, Greece |alma_mater = [[National and Kapodistrian University of Athens]] |occupation = [[Shipowner]]
[[Businessperson]]
[[Business Law]]
[[Fencing|Fencer]] |years_active = 1990–2016 |boards = [[Marfin Investment Group]]
[[Superfast Ferries]] }} '''Andreas Vgenopoulos''' (10 December 1953 − 5 Νovember 2016) was the chairman of [[Marfin Investment Group]] and was a major shareholder of [[Panathinaikos FC]]. Vgenopoulos resigned from Panathinaikos in June 2010 citing differences with [[Giannis Vardinogiannis]].[http://www.grreporter.info/en/mr_mig_andreas_vgenopoulos_left_panathinaikos_time_real/2894/] His departure disappointed the fans of Panathinaikos.{{cite news|url=http://www.athensnews.gr/athweb/nathens.prnt_article?e=C&f=13299&t=01&m=A03&aa=1 |title=New cash for a new century |last=Papachristou |first=Harry |date=8 August 2008 |publisher=Athens News |accessdate=2008-08-30 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080821150155/http://www.athensnews.gr/athweb/nathens.prnt_article?e=C&f=13299&t=01&m=A03&aa=1 |archivedate=21 August 2008 }}{{cite news|url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/4dcgi/_w_articles_sport_1_27/05/2008_97039|title=PAO owners name president|date=2008-05-27 |publisher=Kathimerini: English edition|accessdate=2008-08-30}} Vgenopoulos owned 1% of Marfin Popular Bank and 1,5% of the Marfin Investment Group. He had also been a Greek champion of [[Panathinaikos Fencing|Panathinaikos' Fencing]] department.https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/vg/andreas-vgenopoulos-1.html ==Education and business career== Vgenopoulos graduated from [[University of Athens]] with a [[Law school|degree in Law]] and from [[Long Island University]] (U.S.) with an [[MBA]]. Vgenopoulos was a shareholder of Panathinaikos FC until June 2010, owning 20% of the club's shares. He was also a member of the board of directors of the club alongside [[Giannis Vardinogiannis]] and [[Pavlos Giannakopoulos]]. Panathinaikos is now owned by "Panathinaiki Symmahia" (Panthenaic Alliance) with [[Giannis Alafouzos]] as president.{{cite web |url = http://www.paomprosta.gr/el/node/56 |title = ΙΔΡΥΤΙΚΗ ΔΙΑΚΗΡΥΞΗ "ΠΑΝΑΘΗΝΑΙΚΗΣ ΣΥΜΜΑΧΙΑΣ 2012" |last = |first = |date = |website = Panathianiki Symmahia |publisher = Panathianiki Symmahia |accessdate = 13 March 2014}} Vgenopoulos was also the chairman of [[Olympic Air]], the oldest Greek airline. Marfin Investment Group (MIG) bought the company from the Greek government on 1 October 2009. During the last three years, Mr. Vgenopoulos' MIG fund has seen the wealth deteriorate, it is reported that it has lost 95% of its value. Mr. Vgenopoulos is in the process of selling Olympic to Aegean.{{cite web |url = https://www.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424127887324251504578579423381608656 |title = Tycoon's Rise and Fall: A Modern Greek Drama |last = Ball and Granitsas |first = Deborah and Alkman |date = 12 July 2013 |website = The Wall Street Journal |publisher = The Wall Street Journal |accessdate = 13 March 2014}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.grreporter.info/en/mr_mig_andreas_vgenopoulos_left_panathinaikos_time_real/2894/ grreporter.info] * [http://www.paomprosta.gr/el/node/56 paomprosta.gr] {{DEFAULTSORT:Vgenopoulos, Andreas}} [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:2016 deaths]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Athens]] [[Category:Greek male fencers]] [[Category:Panathinaikos fencers]] [[Category:Panathinaikos A.O.]] [[Category:Olympic fencers of Greece]] [[Category:Fencers at the 1972 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Greek football chairmen and investors]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople in shipping]] [[Category:National and Kapodistrian University of Athens alumni]] {{Greece-footy-bio-stub}} {{Greece-business-bio-stub}}

[[Malay titles|Tun]] '''Azizan bin Zainul Abidin''' (28 May 1935 - 14 July 2004) was a [[Malaysians|Malaysian]] corporate figure and president of the [[Putrajaya Corporation]] and of [[Petronas]].
==Life== Azizan was born on May 28, 1935, in [[Air Itam]], [[Penang]]. He had 3 children with his wife Noor Ainne Chen Teh: Amir Hamzah Azizan, Norizan Azizan and Ikhwan Azizan and 7 grand children
==Career== In 1960 he joined the Ministry of Education, becoming senior private secretary to the [[Prime Minister of Malaysia|Second Prime Minister of Malaysia]], [[Tun Abdul Razak|Tun Abdul Razak Hussein]] (1971-1974). In 1988, he retired as chief secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs.
==Post-government career== Azizan joined [[Petronas]] as Petronas President and Chief Executive Officer, holding the position from February 1988 to February 1995. In addition, he was a chairman of [[Malaysia Airlines]], [[Putrajaya Corporation]], [[Kuala Lumpur City Centre|KLCC Holdings (M) Sdn Bhd]], Petronas Carigali Sdn Bhd, MTBE Malaysia Sdn Bhd, Petronas Trading Limited, Malaysia LNG Sdn Bhd and [[Suria KLCC|Suria KLCC Sdn Bhd]].
He is remembered for his work in developing [[Putrajaya]], the Federal Government Administrative Centre.
He was appointed Pro-Chancellor of [[Universiti Teknologi Malaysia]] (UTM) and a member of the [[World Economic Forum]]; Kuala Lumpur hosted the forum in 2002. He was Chairman of the ASEAN-Canada Business Council, Treasurer of the Crime Prevention Foundation and a Member of the Management Improvement Commission of the [[Royal Malaysian Police]].
==Death== Azizan died on July 14, 2004, at the age of 68, and was buried at the Muslim Cemetery in [[Taman Selatan]], [[Putrajaya]].
==Honours== On June 5, 2010, five years after his death, he was posthumously awarded the Malaysian federal highest award, the [[Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia|Seri Setia Mahkota Malaysia]] (SSM), which carries the title "Tun" in conjunction with the birthday of the 13th [[Yang di-Pertuan Agong]], [[Tuanku Mizan Zainal Abidin]], at [[Istana Negara, Jalan Istana|Istana Negara]], [[Kuala Lumpur]].
He also received the [[Legion of Honour|Order of the Commander of the Legion of Honour]] from the French government in October 2003, the Norwegian government award for "outstanding contribution to quality " in management in 1992 and the Vietnam Friendship Medal by the government in September 2001.
===Honours of Malaysia=== * {{flagu|Malaysia}} : Commander of the [[Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia#Commander|Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia]] (P.S.M.) (1987)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.istiadat.gov.my/index.php/component/semakanlantikanskp/|title=Semakan Penerima Darjah Kebesaran, Bintang dan Pingat}}</ref> * {{flagu|Malaysia}} : Grand Commander of the [[Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia]] (S.S.M.) (2010)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.istiadat.gov.my/v8/images/stories/Tahun_2010.pdf|title=Senarai Penuh Penerima Darjah Kebesaran, Bintang dan Pingat Persekutuan Tahun 2010.}}</ref>
===Named after him=== A cargo ship converted by Petronas for use in the [[Eastern Sabah Security Zone]] is named after him.
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://youngleadershipvoices.blogspot.com/2012/10/a-gem-among-gems-tun-azizan-zainul_22.html A GEM AMONG THE GEMS: TUN AZIZAN ZAINUL ABIDIN - Young Leadership Voices] *[http://mypemuda.blogspot.com/2012/02/tun-azizan-zainul-abidin-permata-yang.html Tun Azizan Zainul Abidin - Permata Yang Hilang] {{Grand Commander of the Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abidin, Azizan Zainul}} [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:2005 deaths]] [[Category:Knights Commander of the Most Exalted Order of the Star of Sarawak]] [[Category:Malaysian people of Malay descent]] [[Category:Malaysian Muslims]] [[Category:People from Penang]] [[Category:Malaysian businesspeople]] [[Category:Grand Commanders of the Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia]] {{Malaysia-bio-stub}}

[[File:William Holman Hunt - The Scapegoat.jpg|thumb|''[[The Scapegoat (painting)|The Scapegoat]]'' by [[William Holman Hunt]] (1854)]]
'''Buck passing''', or '''passing the buck''', is the act of attributing to another person or group, one's own responsibility. It is often used to refer to a strategy in [[power politics]] whereby a state tries to get another state to deter or possibly fight an aggressor state while it remains on the sidelines.<ref>{{cite book|last=John|first=Mearsheimer|title=The Tragedy of Great Power Politics|year=2001|publisher=W. W. Norton & Company|location=New York|isbn=9780393076240|pages=157–58|url=https://books.google.com/books/about/The_Tragedy_of_Great_Power_Politics.html?id=lDzCD_C_ipoC}}</ref>
==Etymology== The expression is said to have originated from [[poker]], in which a marker or counter (such as a knife with a buckhorn handle during the [[American Frontier]] era) was used to indicate the person whose turn it was to [[poker dealer|deal]]. If the player did not wish to deal he could pass the responsibility by passing the "[[button (poker)|buck]]", as the counter came to be called, to the next player.<ref>Mitford M. Mathews, ed., ''A Dictionary of Americanisms on Historical Principles'' (Chicago, University of Chicago Press, 1951), I, pp. 198–99.</ref>
Another less common but arguably less fanciful attribution is to the French expression ''[[:fr:bouc émissaire|bouc émissaire]]'', meaning "scapegoat", whereby passing the ''bouc'' is equivalent to passing the blame or onus.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www3.christs.cam.ac.uk/cms_misc/media/Chapel-Sermons-Lectures/innocent.pdf|format=PDF|title=Sermon preached by Professor Paul Gifford, in Christ’s College, Cambridge|date=17 February 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140322082138/http://www3.christs.cam.ac.uk/cms_misc/media/Chapel-Sermons-Lectures/innocent.pdf|archivedate=22 March 2014|df=}}</ref> The terms ''bouc émissaire'' and ''[[scapegoat]]'' both originate from an [[Old Testament]] ([https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Leviticus+16%3A6-10 Lev. 16:6–10]) reference to an animal that was ritually made to carry the burden of sins, after which the "buck" was sent or "passed"{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} into the wilderness to expiate them.
==In international relations== Passing the buck in international relations theory involves the tendency of nation-states to refuse to confront a growing threat in the hopes that another state will. The most notable example of this was the refusal of the United Kingdom, United States, France, or the [[Soviet Union]] to effectively confront [[Nazi Germany]] during the 1930s. With the [[Munich Agreement]], France and the United Kingdom successfully avoided armed confrontation with Germany, passing the buck to the Soviet Union. The Soviet Union then passed the buck back to the western powers by signing the [[Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact]].<ref>{{cite journal|last = Christensen|first = Thomas|author2 = Jack Snyder|title = Chain Gangs and Passed Bucks: Predicting Alliance Patterns in Multipolarity|journal = International Organization|volume = 44|issue = 2|pages = 137–68|year = 1990|url = http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/~olau/ir/archive/chr1.pdf|format = PDF|deadurl = yes|accessdate = June 6, 2017|doi = 10.1017/S0020818300035232|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080907195946/http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/~olau/ir/archive/chr1.pdf|archivedate = September 7, 2008|df = }}</ref>
Similarly, [[John Mearsheimer]] argues that the delay of the Normandy invasion shows that a buck passing state can shift the balance of power in its favor: "There is no question that the United States benefited greatly from delaying the Normandy invasion until late in the war, when both the German and the Soviet armies were battered and worn down. Not surprisingly, [[Joseph Stalin]] believed that the United Kingdom and the United States were purposely allowing Germany and the Soviet Union to bleed each other white, so that those offshore balancers [the United States and the United Kingdom] could dominate postwar Europe."<ref>{{cite book|last=John|first=Mearsheimer|title=The Tragedy of Great Power Politics|year=2001|publisher=W. W. Norton & Company|location=New York|isbn=9780393076240|page=160|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=lDzCD_C_ipoC&pg=PT177}}</ref>
=="The buck stops here"== [[Image:Truman pass-the-buck.jpg|thumb|At the recreation of the Truman [[Oval Office]] at the Truman Library in 1959, the former [[Harry S. Truman|President Truman]] poses by his old desk which has the famous "The Buck Stops Here" sign.]]
'''"The buck stops here"''' is a phrase that was popularized by [[U.S. President]] [[Harry S. Truman]], who kept a sign with that phrase on his desk in the [[Oval Office]].<ref name="trumanlibrary">{{cite web|url=http://www.trumanlibrary.org/buckstop.htm|title=Truman: The Buck Stops Here|work=trumanlibrary.org}}</ref> The phrase refers to the notion that the President has to make the decisions and accept the ultimate responsibility for those decisions. Truman received the sign as a gift from a prison warden who was also an avid poker player. It is also the motto of the [[List of aircraft carriers of the United States Navy|U.S. Naval Aircraft Carrier]] [[USS Harry S. Truman (CVN-75)|USS ''Harry S. Truman'' (CVN-75)]].<ref>Jan R. Van Meter, ''[[Tippecanoe and Tyler Too]]: Famous Slogans and Catchphrases in American History''.</ref>
President [[Jimmy Carter]] arranged to borrow the sign from the [[Harry S. Truman Presidential Library and Museum]].<ref>{{cite news|title=‘Buck Stops Here’ To Be Sign of Carter|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1977/02/06/archives/buck-stops-here-to-be-sign-of-carter.html|accessdate=30 August 2016|newspaper=The New York Times|date=6 February 1977}}</ref> Footage from Carter's "Address to the Nation on Energy"<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-tPePpMxJaA|title=President Jimmy Carter – Address to the Nation on Energy|date=28 March 2008|work=YouTube}}</ref> shows the sign on the desk during his administration.
The reverse of the sign reads, "I'm from Missouri."<ref name="trumanlibrary" /> This is a reference to Truman's home state, as well as [[Willard Duncan Vandiver]]'s statement, "I'm from Missouri. You've got to show me".
==See also== {{Wiktionary}} {{columns-list|colwidth=30em| * [[Button (poker)]] * [[Bystander effect]] * [[Command responsibility]] * [[wikt:deer in the headlights|Deer in the headlights]] <!--''[[Passing the Buck (1919)]]'' --> * [[Peter principle]] * [[Scapegoat]] * [[Somebody else's problem]] * [[Tragedy of the commons]] }} {{clear}}

'''Customer knowledge''' ('''CK''') is the combination of experience, value and insight information which is needed, created and absorbed during the transaction and exchange between the [[customer]]s and enterprise.<ref name=gebert2002>{{cite journal|last1=Gebert|first1=Henning|last2=Geib|first2=Malte|last3=Kolbe|first3=Lutz|last4=Riempp|first4=Gerold|url=http://iceb.nccu.edu.tw/proceedings/2002/PDF/f262.pdf|title=Towards customer knowledge management: Integrating customer relationship management and knowledge management concepts|journal=The Second International Conference on Electronic Business (ICEB 2002)|date=2002}}</ref> Campbell (2003) defines customer knowledge as: "organized and structured information about the customer as a result of systematic processing".<ref>{{cite journal|author=Campbell, A. J.|year=2003|title=Creating customer knowledge competence: Managing customer relationship management programs strategically|journal=Industrial marketing management|volume=32|pages=375–383|doi=10.1016/S0019-8501(03)00011-7}}</ref> According to Mitussis et al. (2006), customer knowledge is identified as one of the more complex types of knowledge, since customer knowledge can be captured from different sources and channels.<ref name="jscdss.com">{{cite journal|last1=Khosravi|first1=Arash|last2=Che Hussin|first2=Ab Razak|title=A Review of Customer Knowledge Management Importance|journal=Journal of Soft Computing and Decision Support Systems|date=2014|volume=1|issue=1|pages=45–52 |url=http://www.jscdss.com/index.php/files/article/view/12}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|author1=Darryn Mitussis|author2=Lisa O'Malley|author3=Maurice Patterson|title=Mapping the re-engagement of CRM with relationship marketing|journal=European Journal of Marketing|volume=40|issue=5/6|pages=572–589|doi=10.1108/03090560610657840}}</ref>
==Classification== Various classifications exist: Gebert et al. (2002), classified customer knowledge from an organization's perspective into three types:<ref name=gebert2002/> #knowledge about customers: is gained mainly by [[service management]], offer management, [[complaint management]] and, if available, contract management. The main user processes of knowledge regarding the customer are campaign management and service management, because both processes personalize their services based on user criteria. Knowledge about the customer must be transparent within the company; although its distribution beyond the border of the company must be controlled, as this type of knowledge can often be directly transformed into competitive advantages. The development of such knowledge is also expensive, because knowledge revelation is quite time-consuming. #knowledge for customers: is mainly developed in processes within the company, for example, the research and development section or a production department. Collecting this knowledge is the responsibility of campaign management. It should be refined according to the customer requirements. It is then disseminated to the other [[customer relationship management]] (CRM) processes, mainly: contract management, offer management, and service management. CRM manages knowledge, transparency and dissemination of knowledge for customers. Maintaining the balance between comprehensibility and precision is the main challenge when managing this kind of knowledge. #knowledge from customers: can be obtained in the same ways as knowledge about customers. Capturing knowledge from customers is based on the important fact that customers who obtain their own expertise when utilizing a service or product can be seen as equal partners. This concept is not regularly understood in the business world and its effects have been poorly researched in academia (Garcia-Murillo and Annabi, 2002).<ref name="jscdss.com"/>
The same categorization of customer knowledge has been made by others such as Bueren et al. (2005) and Feng and Tian (2005).<ref>{{cite journal|author=Bueren, A., Schierholz, R., Kolbe, L., and Brenner, W.|year=2005|title=Improving performance of customer processes with knowledge management|url=https://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/document/download/a080b16584a378f06199ade7ec9c25e0-en.pdf/Improving_performance_of_customer-processes_with_knowledge_management.pdf|journal=Business Process Management Journal|volume=11|issue=5|pages=573–588}}</ref><ref>Feng, T., Tian, J. (2005), "Customer knowledge management and condition analysis of successful CKM implementation", Proceedings of the fourth international Conference on machine learning and cybernetics, Guanghou, August 18–21.</ref> In another categorization, Crié and Micheaux (2006) divide customer knowledge into two types, namely: "Behavioural" (or Quantitative) and "Attitudinal" (or Qualitative). Behavioral knowledge is easy to acquire and is basically quantitative by nature; that is, containing a customer transactional relations with the company. On the other hand, attitudinal knowledge is difficult to acquire because it deals with a customer's [[wikt:state of mind|state of mind]]; but meanwhile it is an important factor for enhancement of customer knowledge because they are directly related to a customer's thoughts and insights.
==See also== *[[Consumer privacy]] *[[Customer intelligence]] *[[Customer relationship management]] *[[Customer Success]] *[[Knowledge engineering]] *[[Knowledge management]] *[[Knowledge transfer]]
Journals: *''[[Electronic Journal of Knowledge Management]]'' *''[[Journal of Knowledge Management]]'' *''[[Journal of Knowledge Management Practice]]''
==References== {{reflist|33em}}

{{Orphan|date=March 2017}}
{{Infobox person |name = Darío Straschnoy |image = |image_size = |caption = Darío Straschnoy |birth_date = |birth_place = Argentina |death_date = |death_place = |other_names = |known_for = founder and CEO of The Juju, Chairman of Untold_, former president of [[Young & Rubicam]] Argentina |occupation = Communications executive |education = |nationality = Argentina |spouse = }}
'''Dario Straschnoy''' is an Argentine communications executive, Chairman of Untold_ and CEO of The Juju. He is recognized for his work as President and partner of [[Young & Rubicam]]'s Argentine office.
== Early career == Dario Straschnoy began his advertising career after studying [[Psychology]] at [[Buenos Aires University]]. At the end of high school, he worked at his father's glassware and when he was 20 years old, he began his own business: publishing [[classified ads]].<ref>[http://www.apertura.com/target/Dario-Straschnoy-Una-usina-creativa-exige-ser-coherente-todos-los-dias-20130322-0005.html Carla Quiroga, 'Darío Straschnoy: 'Una usina creativa exige ser coherente todos los días'', ''Apertura Magazine'', 03/22/2013] {{es}}</ref>
In 1988, when he was part of Funes, Straschnoy & Dreyfus agency, he partnered with the multinational agency [[Young & Rubicam]] and assumed the presidency.<ref>[http://www.apertura.com/target/Dario-Straschnoy-Una-usina-creativa-exige-ser-coherente-todos-los-dias-20130322-0005.html Carla Quiroga, 'Darío Straschnoy: 'Una usina creativa exige ser coherente todos los días'', ''Apertura Magazine'', 03/22/2013] {{es}}</ref> Years later, in 2000, the company was bought and absorbed by [[WPP plc|WPP]], one of the largest groups of communication services worldwide.<ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/17854-young-rubicam-numero-uno-en-el-pais-y-en-el-mundo Alberto Borrini, 'Young & Rubicam, número uno en el país y en el mundo', ''La Nación newspaper'', 05/23/2000] {{es}}</ref>
== Young & Rubicam == [[Young & Rubicam]], one of the largest advertising agencies in the world, was founded in [[Philadelphia]] in 1923 and currently has 465 offices in 90 countries.
The agency came to Argentina in 1979 and Darío Straschnoy was the President from 1988 until the end of 2013.<ref>[http://www.cronista.com/negocios/-Dario-Straschnoy-se-aleja-de-YampR-tras-mas-de-25-anos-al-frente-de-la-agencia-20131211-0099.html ''Cronista.com'', 'Darío Straschnoy se aleja de Y&R tras más de 25 años al frente de la agencia', 12/11/2013] {{es}}</ref>
He developed and was responsible of all the operations of Young & Rubicam group in Argentina, composed of four companies: Young & Rubicam, [[Wunderman]], [[MEC (media agency)|MEC]] and [[Burson Marsteller]].
The company was responsible of very successful local advertising campaigns, such as the couple of Marcos and Claudia from [[Banco Galicia]], which began in 2009 and still continues.<ref>[http://www.dossiernet.com.ar/articulo/marcos-y-claudia-entre-la-gente-lo-nuevo-de-young-para-banco-galicia/874 ''DossierNet'', ''Marcos y Claudia entre la gente', lo nuevo de Young para Banco Galicia', 04/15/2014] {{es}}</ref> They were also the creators of the controversial spot secretly filmed in [[Falkland Islands]] for the [[Argentine government]], because of its participation at the [[London Olympic Games]] 2012.<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2138926/Falkland-Islands-London-2012-Olympics-ad-shows-athlete-training-Argentine-soil-Port-Stanley.html ''Daily Mail'', ''To compete on English soil, we train on Argentinian soil': TV ad highlighting claim over Falklands filmed in Port Stanley', 05/03/2012]</ref>
During his tenure at Young & Rubicam he worked for prestigious brands such as [[Danone]], [[Cerveza Quilmes|Quilmes beer]], [[Visa Inc.|Visa]] and Tulipán [[condoms]].<ref>[http://www.mercado.com.ar/notas/para-entender/8014066/los-anunciantes-buscan-buenas-ideas-en-el-lugar-que-se-las-den Leandro Africano, 'Los anunciantes buscan buenas ideas en el lugar que se las den', ''Mercado magazine'', 12/11/2013] {{es}}</ref> Also, for fifteen years, he was in charge of advertising APSA -owner of the Argentine shoppings Alto Palermo, Abasto and Alto Avellaneda, among others, the cell phone company [[Movistar]], the [[candy]] factory [[Grupo Arcor|Arcor]], [[DirecTV]], ''[[El Cronista]]'' newspaper, Farmacity chain, ''[[Olé (sports newspaper)|Olé]]'' sports newspaper, the stereo and appliances Musimundo, the sports TV channel TyCSports and [[Monsanto]], among others.<ref>[http://www.aapublicidad.org.ar/web/young-rubicam/ Young & Rubicam a Asociación Argentina de Publicidad (Argentine Advertising Association) website] {{es}}</ref>
Under the leadership of Straschnoy, Young & Rubicam won awards at the major festivals worldwide, including more than twenty five [[Cannes Lions]].
In 2012 and 2013, it was chosen as the best advertising agency of the year in the Jerry Goldenberg Awards for Excellence in Communications<ref>[http://www.dossiernet.com.ar/jerry_goldenberg Jerry Goldenberg Awards for Excellence in Communications official website] {{es}}</ref> and in 2011 it was the most awarded in Effie Awards.<ref>[http://www.iprofesional.com/notas/123588-Young--Rubicam-fue-la-favorita-en-los-premios-Effie-Awards ''iProfesional.com'', 'Young & Rubicam fue la favorita en los premios Effie Awards', 10/05/2011] {{es}}</ref>
The same year it was awarded Agency of the Year and received a ‘Lápiz de Platino’ Award ('Silver Pencil' Award). Under Straschnoy’s leadership, the agency won twenty ‘Lápiz de Platino’, seven of them where at TV category,<ref>[http://www.iprofesional.com/notas/116098-Young--Rubicam-gan-el-Lpiz-de-Platino-por-el-mejor-spot-del-ao?page_y=560 ''iProfesional.com'', 'Young & Rubicam ganó el Lápiz de Platino por el mejor spot del año', 05/17/2011] {{es}}</ref> five of which were as the best agency.
Also, they have more than fifty awards in different festivals such as [[Clio Awards]], Wave Rio, [[San Sebastian Film Festival|San Sebastian]], FIAP, Buenos Anuncios, Clarin Awards (Grand Prix), El Ojo de Iberoamerica, The Sun, [[New York Film Festival|New York]] and London Festival, among others.<ref>[http://www.yrargentina.com.ar/en/ Young & Rubicam Argentina website]</ref>
On the other hand, Young & Rubicam won eleven [[Martín Fierro awards]] in the 'Best Advertising Notice' shortlist.
The agency also ranked first in the Global Ranking of Advertising Agencies, whose name is AgencyScope, which is conducted by the Spanish Consulting Group.<ref>[http://www.mercado.com.ar/notas/protagonistas/8017257/yr-es-la-agencia-ms-reconocida-del-mercado ''Mercado'' magazine, 'Y&R es la agencia más reconocida del mercado', 01/28/2015] {{es}}</ref>
== Untold_ == Currently, Straschnoy is the Chairman of Untold_, an ecosystem of communications professionals. He is also the CEO of The Juju, Untold_'s creative agency. He founded Carlos y Darío in early 2014, along with publicist Carlos Baccetti – founder of Latin American agency Agulla & Baccetti- a month after leaving Young & Rubicam.<ref>[http://www.adlatina.com.ar/publicidad/straschnoy-y-baccetti-presentan-su-nueva-agencia Alfredo Sainz, 'Straschnoy y Baccetti presentan su nueva agencia', ''ADNLatina.com.ar'', 01/09/2014] {{es}}</ref>. The company quickly grew and was joined by other communications companies in what became Untold_. The company has offices in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Sao Paulo]], [[Medellín]], [[New York City]] and [[Bogotá]].<ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1793322-las-bodas-de-papel-de-carlos-baccettiy-dario-straschnoy José del Río, 'Las bodas de papel de Carlos Baccetti y Darío Straschnoy', ''La Nación'' newspaper, 05/17/2015] {{es}}</ref>
Since its beginnings, the agency works with companies such as [[DirecTV]] and [[Quaker Oats Company|Quaker]] regionally, wines Álamos and Bravío from Catena Zapata [[winery]], V Energy Drink, [[Toddy (PepsiCo)|Toddy]] cookies by [[PepsiCo]], the daily business ''[[El Cronista Comercial]]'', [[Noticias (magazine)|Noticias]] magazine from Perfil publishing, Industrial Bank and GranDT by ''[[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarin]]''.
For Toddy cookies, Carlos y Darío filmed the first campaign created in collaboration with the followers of the brand in social networks like [[Facebook]], [[Twitter]], [[Instagram]], [[Snapchat]] and [[Periscope]], in a live basis. These commercials were broadcast on TV.<ref>[http://www.infonegocios.info/Nota.asp?nrc=53174 Mercedes Beracochea, 'CyD y el spot de las redes', ''InfoNegocios.info'', 06/22/2015] {{es}}</ref>
As for recognition, the agency won two ‘Lápiz de Oro’ at Mix Media category for the film ''[[Death in Buenos Aires]]'' campaign<ref>[http://www.dossiernet.com.ar/articulo/dos-lapices-de-oro-para-carlos-dario-toddy-y-muerte-en-buenos-aires-junto-a-innovation-media/1872 ''DossierNet'', 'Dos Lápices de Oro para Carlos & Darío: Toddy y Muerte en Buenos Aires junto a Innovation Media', 06/18/2014] {{es}}</ref> and its performance on social networks at Toddy cookies campaign. In addition, in 2015 it won its first Silver Young Lion in [[Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity|Cannes]] at ‘Print’ category.<ref>[https://www.canneslions.com/cannes_lions/awards/print_young_lions_competition_winners/ ''Young Lions Print Competition Winners 2015'', Cannes Lions official website]</ref>
== Awards and Recognitions == Darío Straschnoy was chosen as one of the men with the best reputation in the country by Merco ranking and consulting Villafañe y Asociados. In 2011, for example, he was ranked 29 and in 2013 he was the only employer in advertising industry that integrated the ranking.<ref>[http://www.ieco.clarin.com/economia/Ranking-lideres-empresarios-mayor-prestigio_0_1203479980.html Annabella Quiroga, 'Ranking de los 100 líderes empresarios de mayor prestigio', ''Clarín'' newspaper, 08/31/14] {{es}}</ref>
In 1997 he won the [[Konex Award]] and was recognized as one of the top five advertisers of that decade.<ref>[http://www.fundacionkonex.org/b1674-dar%C3%ADo_straschnoy [[Konex Foundation]] website] {{es}}</ref> Ten years later, in 2007, he was part of the jury that chose the best advertisers of the past decade.<ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/945342-premios-konex-reconocimiento-a-publicitarios-y-comunicadores Alberto Borrini, 'Premios Konex: reconocimiento a publicitarios y comunicadores', ''La Nación'' newspaper, 09/19/2007] {{es}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
== External links == * [http://thejuju.agency/ The Juju's website] * [http://untold.site/ Untold_'s website]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Straschnoy, Dario}} [[Category:Argentine businesspeople]] [[Category:Advertising people]] [[Category:Living people]]

revision.text:
'''Dolores “Dolly” Aglay-Elona''' (c.1967 – May 26, 2008) was a [[Philippines|Filipino]] [[business]] and [[financial]] [[journalist]] who worked for the [[Manila]] [[news bureau]] of [[Reuters|Reuters News Agency]] and the [[Philippine Star]] during her career.<ref name=abs>{{cite news|first=|last=|title=Manila-based Reuters journalist dies of cancer|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/storypage.aspx?StoryId=119575|work=[[ABS-CBN Broadcasting Corporation]]|publisher=|date=2008-05-26|accessdate=2008-06-02}}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
Aglay joined Reuters as a [[business reporter]] in 1995.<ref name=abs/> She had previously also worked as a business reporter for the [[Philippine Star]].<ref name=abs/> Aglay specialized in reporting on [[commodity]] stories, such as [[food pricing]], while reporting for Reuters.<ref name=abs/>
Dolly Aglay died of [[cancer]], which she had been battling for almost 3 years, in [[Manila]] on May 26, 2008, at the age of 41.<ref name=abs/> According to her husband, [[Philippine Star]] [[reporter]] [[Mel Elona]], she had been disappointed that she could not [[news reporting|report]] as actively on her stories while being treated for her illness.<ref name=abs/> She "kept talking about missing out on one of the biggest commodities stories of recent years in the Philippines, the rise in rice prices over the past few months."<ref name=abs/>
Aglay was buried at [[Heritage Memorial Park]] in Manila on Sunday, June 1, 2008.<ref name=pdi>{{cite news|first=|last=|title=Dolly Aglay necro Saturday|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/metro/view/20080529-139618/Dolly-Aglay-necro-Saturday|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|publisher=|date=2008-05-29|accessdate=2008-06-02|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080601025146/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/metro/view/20080529-139618/Dolly-Aglay-necro-Saturday|archivedate=2008-06-01|df=}}</ref> She was survived by her husband, journalist Melchor “Mel” Elona, and their two children, Julian and Fides.<ref name=pdi/> She was also survived by her parents, Pastor Sr. and Maximiana, and her siblings, Josephine, Jane and Pastor Jr.<ref name=pdi/>
In 2009, Mel married his former fianceé and long-time friend, editor and short story author, May Alcalde, and now lives with her, their daughter Margarita, and Julian and Fides.
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Aglay, Dolly}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:Filipino journalists]] [[Category:Business and financial journalists]] [[Category:Deaths from cancer in the Philippines]] [[Category:Burials at The Heritage Park]]
{{Philippines-bio-stub}}

'''Dulcie Boling''' (born Elizabeth Dulcie Boling on 29 March 1936) is an [[Australian people|Australian]] businessperson and magazine editor.She was born in Kyrabram, Victoria in Australia.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Clarke |first1=Patricia |title=Dulcie Boling (1936 - ) |url=http://www.academia.edu/19603059/Dulcie_Boling_1936_-_ |website=A Companion to the Australian Media |publisher=Academia.edu |accessdate=19 September 2018 |language=en}}</ref> She was [[Editor#Executive editor|editor]] of [[New Idea]] magazine from 1977 to 1993.<ref name="The Daily Telegraph (Sydney) - 19 May 2013 - ABC series Paper Giants: Magazine Wars sheds new light on editors Nene King and Dulcie Boling">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/opinion/abc-series-paper-giants-magazine-wars-sheds-new-light-on-editors-nene-king-and-dulcie-boling/story-fni0cwl5-1226645946618|title=ABC series Paper Giants: Magazine Wars sheds new light on editors Nene King and Dulcie Boling |last=Sharp |first=Annette|date=May 19, 2013|work=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]|publisher=[[News Limited]]|accessdate=4 June 2013}}</ref> Boling was a senior executive of Southdown Press, which later became [[Pacific Magazines]].<ref name="The Daily Telegraph (Sydney) - 19 May 2013 - ABC series Paper Giants: Magazine Wars sheds new light on editors Nene King and Dulcie Boling"/>She served as the chairperson and executive chairman of Southdown Press and Chief Executive Magazines of PMP Limited from 1992-1993.<ref>{{cite web |title=Terms of Service Violation |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=11519454&privcapId=140678886&previousCapId=241286069&previousTitle=SEVEN%20GROUP%20HOLDINGS%20LTD |website=www.bloomberg.com |accessdate=19 September 2018}}</ref>
Australian actor [[Rachel Griffiths]] played Boling in the [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] television [[mini-series]] ''[[Paper Giants: Magazine Wars]]'', a sequel to ''[[Paper Giants: The Birth of Cleo]]''.<ref name="The Courier-Mail - 29 May 2013 - The battle of the gossip queens in Paper Giants: Magazine Wars ">{{cite news|url=http://www.couriermail.com.au/entertainment/television/the-battle-of-the-gossip-queens/story-fncaks2k-1226652712267|title=The battle of the gossip queens in Paper Giants: Magazine Wars |last=Devlyn|first=Darren|date=May 29, 2013|work=[[The Courier-Mail]]|publisher=[[News Limited]]|accessdate=4 June 2013}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Boling, Dulcie}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian businesspeople]] [[Category:Date of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:1936 births]]

{{infobox person/Wikidata | fetchwikidata=ALL | onlysourced=yes | organization = [[National Council of European Resistance]] }}
'''Eliana Benador''' (also '''Eleana Benador''') is a Swiss-American public relations consultant, global strategist, and a publicist for American and Middle Eastern [[neo-conservatives]].<ref name=lobe>Lobe, Jim, [http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Front_Page/EH15Aa01.html ''The Andean Condor among the Hawks’'], Asian Times, August 15, 2003</ref> Through the development of Benador Associates, Benador was promoted national security policies advocated by the [[Presidency of George W. Bush|Bush administration]] concerning Iraqi regime change, the [[Iraq War]], and [[hard-line]] attitudes toward Iran.<ref name=lobe /><ref name="cohler-esses">Cohler-Esses, Larry [http://www.thenation.com/doc/20060703/cohleresses ''Bunkum From Benador’'], The Nation, July 3, 2006</ref> As of 2007, Benador had closed Benador Associates and opened a new firm, Benador Public Relations.
==Career== Benador studied linguistics, psychology and political science at the [[Sorbonne]] and the [[Université Catholique de Lille]]{{when|date=September 2012}}. Following university, she worked as an editor for the Peruvian Times and as a translator at the United Nations in Vienna.<ref name=hagan>Hagan, Joe, [http://www.observer.com/node/47358 ''She's Richard Perle's Oyster''], The New York Observer, April 6, 2003</ref> In 2000, Benador joined the [[Middle East Forum]], an American conservative<ref>MacFarquhar, Neil, [https://www.nytimes.com/2007/03/14/washington/14cair.html?_r=2&pagewanted=all&oref=slogin&oref=slogin ''Scrutiny Increases for a Group Advocating for Muslims in U.S.''] The New York Times, March 14, 2007</ref> [[think tank]], to work as the associate director of, and in charge of the expansion of, the Middle East Forum in New York, and she also was the media liaison of its founder [[Daniel Pipes]]. Benador left the MEF after eighteen months because of conflicts with Pipes.<ref name=hagan /> According to Pipes, they came to a mutual and amicable "understanding that she would do better on her own."<ref name=hagan />
In October 2001, Benador began her own public relations firm, Benador & Associates. After signing former C.I.A. director [[James Woolsey]] and ''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]'' columnist [[A.M. Rosenthal]], Benador's firm built a clientele of American neo-conservatives. Benador was criticized for "acting as a kind of public-relations firm for the war."<ref name=hagan /><ref>Whitaker, Brian [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/feb/24/worlddispatch.usa ''Conflict and catchphrases''], The Guardian, February 24, 2003</ref>
In January 2011, Benador was appointed Goodwill Ambassador of the Shomron (Samaria) Liaison Office in the U.S. and Europe. In that capacity, she addressed the Rally in Support of Israel across the Israel Consulate in New York City, offering proportional comparison by population of the United States to the numbers of Israeli victims of terrorist attacks; according to Benador the 1,200 Israelis victimized from 2000 to 2010 would correspond to 50,297 Americans, while the 8,342 wounded would compare to 350,000.<ref>Domnitch, Larry, [http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/143189 ''New York rally: Israel has rights too ''], Arutz Sheva, March 28, 2011</ref>
==Selected articles== *[http://www.gulfnews.com/opinion/columns/world/10231502.html ''Surveillance law takes its toll in Sweden''], The Gulf News, July 25, 2008 *[http://www.gulfnews.com/Opinion/Columns/world/10241843.html ''Can Palin make a difference?], The Gulf News, September 1, 2008 *[http://www.gulfnews.com/Opinion/Columns/world/10249609.html ''For America, it is the time for change''], The Gulf News, October 3, 2008
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://ElianaBenador.com http://ElianaBenador.com] {{DEFAULTSORT:Benador, Eliana}} [[Category:Swiss businesspeople]] [[Category:American businesspeople]] [[Category:American public relations people]] [[Category:University of Paris alumni]] [[Category:Swiss emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Swiss women in business]] [[Category:American women in business]]

revision.text:
[[File:Fishing Permits available - geograph.org.uk - 205766.jpg|thumb|Sign in the United Kingdom alerts people to the need for a fishing permit.]] A '''fishing license''' (US), '''fishing licence''' or '''fishing permit''' is a regulatory or legal mechanism to control [[fishing]]. Licensing is one mechanism of [[fisheries management]] and may be required for either [[commercial fishing|commercial]] or [[recreational fishing]].
==Historical licensing== [[File:Chinese fishing license from the Qing era in the Baojiashu jiyao (1838).jpg|thumb|Chinese fishing license from the Qing era in the ''Baojiashu jiyao'' (1838)]]
In 1765, the Chinese [[Qing dynasty]] government required all fishing boat operators to obtain a fishing license under the ''aojia'' system that regulated coastal populations. The [[Tanka people|Dan]] boat people of [[Guangdong]] had to acquire a fishing license as early as 1729. The wooden license issued by the government was to be displayed on the bow or stern of a boat. The information on the license consisted of the name and age of the boat's owner, the ship's status as either a fishing or commercial vessel, the home port of the boat, crew and family members on board, the date the license was issued, and the registration number of the license.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Antony|first1=Robert J.|title=Elusive Pirates, Pervasive Smugglers Violence and Clandestine Trade in the Greater China Seas|year=2010|publisher=Hong Kong University Press|location=Hong Kong|isbn=9789888028115|pages=95–96}}</ref>
==Types by country== Depending on the jurisdiction, licenses or permits may be required by a government, a property owner, or both.
===United Kingdom=== The government requires a [[fishing rod|rod]] licence for anyone over the age of 12 who fishes in [[England]], [[Wales]] or the [[River Esk, Dumfries and Galloway|Border Esk]] area in [[Scotland]] for [[salmon]], [[trout]], freshwater fish, [[smelt (fish)|smelt]] or [[eel]]s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.environment-agency.gov.uk/homeandleisure/recreation/fishing/38081.aspx |title=Rod Fishing Licence - Frequently Asked Questions |publisher=Environment Agency |location=UK |accessdate=February 6, 2014}}</ref> In addition, anyone who fishes in a non-[[estuarine]] [[stream]], [[lake]], or [[canal]] needs a permit from the owner of the fishing rights to the water body, which might be a local [[angling club]], a landowner with [[riparian right]]s, or an organization such as the [[Canal & River Trust]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://canalrivertrust.org.uk/contact-us/faqs/fishing |title=FAQs about fishing at the Canal & River Trust|publisher=Canal & River Trust |location=UK |accessdate=February 6, 2014}}</ref>
===Ireland=== In [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]], rights to fish in non-tidal freshwater also are owned either by the government or by private entities such as angling club. The ownership of fishing rights in Ireland derives from the [[Plantations of Ireland|confiscation of lands]] by the [[British Crown]] in the 17th century; the boundaries of fishing rights areas typically follow the boundaries of estates granted by the Crown.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fisheriesireland.ie/State-Fisheries/history-of-fishing-rights-in-ireland.html |title=History of fishing rights in Ireland |publisher=Inland Fisheries Ireland |accessdate=February 6, 2014}}</ref>
===United States=== The U.S. state of [[Oregon]] instituted a requirement for commercial fishing licenses in 1899, the same year that the state's [[sturgeon]] fishery had collapsed due to over-harvesting. Oregon began requiring recreational fishing licenses in 1901.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dfw.state.or.us/agency/history.asp |title=ODFW History, 1792 - 2000 |publisher=Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife |accessdate=February 5, 2014}}</ref> [[Indiana]] began issuing [[hunting license]]s in 1901 and added fishing privileges to its hunting license in 1913.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.in.gov/dnr/fishwild/5446.htm |title=History of Fish & Wildlife |publisher=Indiana Department of Natural Resources |accessdate=February 5, 2014}}</ref> The state of [[Pennsylvania]] first issued recreational fishing licenses in 1919. Licenses were required only for nonresidents, and only 50 licenses were issued that first year. In 1922, when the state first required licenses for state residents, over 2,700 nonresident licenses and over 200,000 resident licenses were sold.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fishandboat.com/licsal2.htm |title=Pennsylvania Fishing License Sales, 1919 to Present |publisher=Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission |accessdate=February 5, 2014}}</ref>
== License free fishing == Some countries don't require a license for recreational sea fishing, provided that certain rules in regard to fish size, numbers and total catch are followed.
=== Belgium === Recreational fishing in the sea does not require a license in certain spots. Size limits need to be followed. Also need to have a freshwater permit when fishing on certain seadocks<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.cefas.co.uk/publications/files/sportsfishing-c2362.pdf|title=EU contract FISH/2004/011 on "Sport Fisheries" (or Marine Recreational Fisheries) in the EU|last=Pawson|first=M. G.|last2=Tingley|first2=D.|date=2007-03-01|website=|publisher=Prepared For The European Commission Directorate-General for Fisheries|access-date=2016-06-26|last3=Padda|first3=G|last4=Glenn|first4=H.}}</ref>
=== Cyprus === Sea angling and spear fishing without diving equipment is allowed with no licence. Multiple species including seals, dolphins and turtles are protected.<ref name=":0" />
=== Estonia === Estonians have a life-long right to fish with one simple hand line in waters owned by the state and local governments, provided that regulations about species, sizes and seasons are followed.<ref name=":0" />
=== New Zealand === No license is necessary for recreational sea fishing. There are many detailed regulations about fish species, size limits, fishing methods and prohibited areas.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nzfishing.com/AboutFishingInNZ/SaltWaterFishinginNZ.htm|title=New Zealand Saltwater Fly Fishing-Sea and saltwater fly fishing in New Zealand-nzfishing|website=nzfishing.com|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.blueseafishing.co.nz/faq.htm|title=FAQ's about New Zealand Fishing Holidays in the Bay of Islands with Blue Sea Charters|website=www.blueseafishing.co.nz|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref>
=== Norway === Sea fishing from the coast and from the boat is free for both residents and visitors, although there are minimum fish rules and other regulations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.visitnorway.com/things-to-do/great-outdoors/fishing/sea-fishing/|title=Sea fishing|last=|first=|date=|website=Official travel guide to Norway|publisher=|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref>
=== Sweden === For fishing in public waters no license is necessary. Foreign citizens are allowed to fish without license only with hand gear. License free fishing is legal along the sea coast (in many cases also on private land along the coast) and in Sweden's five largest lakes – [[Vänern]], [[Vättern]], [[Hjälmaren]], [[Mälaren]] and [[Storsjön]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.swedenfishing.com/fishing_nature/fishing_rules|title=Fishing rules & ecological angling {{!}} SwedenFishing|website=www.swedenfishing.com|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://relaxfishingsweden.com/en/sport-fishing/sea/|title=The Sea - Relax Fishing Sweden|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.swedishepa.se/Enjoying-nature/The-Right-of-Public-Access/This-is-allowed/Hunting-and-fishing/|title=Hunting and fishing|website=Swedish Environmental Protection Agency|language=en|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref>
=== United Kingdom === Fishing licence for sea fishing is not required in most of the places in the United Kingdom. For salmon and sea trout game licence is required regardless of location.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/articles/sea-angling|title=Sea angling|date=2015-11-16|website=Northern Ireland direct - government services|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.gov.uk/fishing-licences|title=Buy a fishing rod licence - GOV.UK|website=www.gov.uk|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref> In places where saltwater and freshwater cross over the regulations are complicated and licence may be required.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://britishseafishing.co.uk/do-i-need-a-fishing-licence-for-sea-fishing/|title=Do I Need A Fishing Licence for Sea Fishing? {{!}} Britishseafishing.co.uk|website=britishseafishing.co.uk|access-date=2016-06-26}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Hunting license]]
==References== {{reflist}}
